text: Using the drag and drop editor. is there a way to make the search page set a title tag (and also make it so the title tag is modified based on search?)

good question.

you can do it with javascript and you may be able to do it by adding a <title> tag to the head html.

The browser should only display the last title tag used..

But you’re right it should at the very least be something like  “search results for ‘something’ | Sitename”

by default
It's the only page that is pulling errors due to SEO audit.
I tried to convert to html and manipulate but it seems that it's not registering the title tag items

I would go the JS route if adding a second title tag won’t work. from what I’ve read as long as the title change happens shortly after or while loading, the Google will use the JS set title instead of the original
Part of the reason for why search engines allow this is due to SPAs and the fact the user may navigate to other “pages” without actual page changes

i know you can control what domains site search searches. can you get granular with it and have multiple searches set up for different blogs? for example, i have blog #1 and the url is <http://domainname.com/blog|domainname.com/blog> and i want the search on that template to only search <http://domainname.com/blog|domainname.com/blog> and i have blog #2 and the url is <http://domainname.com/knowledge-base|domainname.com/knowledge-base> and i want the search on that template to only search <http://domainname.com/knowledge-base|domainname.com/knowledge-base>
did a little more research it looks like pathPrefix is what i need to set is this correct?
